SoftwareType.Name: Advertisment Editor
SoftwareType.Description: Program that allows you to create online Advertisments.

Feature.Name: Targeting
Feature.Description: Advertising adapted to the Webpage where the ads are placed on.

Feature.Name: Retargeting
Feature.Description: Advertising adapted to the interest of the user, based on Cookies.

Feature.Name: Geotargeting
Feature.Description: Advertising adapted to the environment, based on Geodatas like IP-Adress or GPS.

Feature.Name: Verbal placement
Feature.Description: Advertising adapted to the textbased content on the Webpage.

Feature.Name: Interactivity
Feature.Description: The user can interact with this kind of banners.

Feature.Name: Pop-Up
Feature.Description: A pop-up ad is displayed in a new web browser window that opens above a Webpage visitor's initial browser window.

Feature.Name: Pop-Under
Feature.Description: A pop-under ad opens a new browser window under a Webpage visitor's initial browser window.

Feature.Name: Layer
Feature.Description: A newer type of pop-ups are called layer ads, which collapse with the help of JavaScript the actual content, to force the user's attention. However, no new browser window opens, and popup blockers will not proc.

Feature.Name: Interstials
Feature.Description: An interstitial ad displays before a user can access requested content, sometimes while the user is waiting for the content to load.

Feature.Name: Prestitials
Feature.Description: An interstitial ad displays before a user can access requested content, the user have to wait until a time runs out or have to press a button to close the ad.

Feature.Name: Clips
Feature.Description: A clip shows a short video which can skip the user after a few seconds.

Feature.Name: Skyscraper
Feature.Description: Banners that are particularly high and are therefore wear them left or right on the edge of the site. These are then also still be seen partially at least when scrolling the site. Some marketers also offer formats that "co-migrate" to the side and remain permanently in view of the user.

Feature.Name: Rectangle
Feature.Description: Is comparable to island print ads. Rectangles are positioned directly in the editorial environment of the web. Thus, a strong awareness of the advertising message with the user and good response rates for advertisers is achieved. The Rectangle is well suited for branding campaigns. Another advantage is the specific, rectangular format that offers plenty of room for creativity.

Feature.Name: Content
Feature.Description: Content Ad is advertising in the editorial section of a Webpage that blurs as well as possible with the actual content of the site. The result is that one or the other visitors only later realizes that he has read advertising rather content of the Webpage.
